channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Remote work is officially dead: 3 days in the office is the new norm, says CEO of the world’s biggest recruiter—except for ‘very special’ talent
item.description: The return-to-office war is over and a new pecking order has emerged, says Randstad's CEO Sander van ’t Noordende. Remote work is now a top-performer ...

item.title: As AI investors fret over ROI, these startups attracted serious cash from customers in 2025
item.description: A Brex survey shows that coding and video are reaping big customer gains.

item.title: AptarGroup CEO: China is unfazed by Trump’s tariffs because their ‘grit and sheer willpower is on a different scale’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Why coyotes won’t become the new wolves and what it has to do with moose and beaver
item.description: Starting around 1900, coyotes began expanding their range east and have now colonized nearly all of eastern North America.

item.title: Little-known underground salt caverns could slow the AI boom and its thirst for power
item.description: Power demand, gas production, and pipeline and power plant construction are soaring, but the storage space for natural gas is running out.

item.title: This CEO has words of caution for people jumping ship to work at AI startups
U.S. stocks close higher as hopes for a 'Santa Claus rally' build
How that $1.6 billion Powerball jackpot may end up more like $128.5 million
Shipbuilder's stock soars to fresh record on contract to make Navy's new warship
AI power scramble intensifies with Alphabet’s purchase of data-center partner
